intro: Oxydectes horminum, commonly known as the common oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Oxydectes horminum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
